text: Mahogny color, small white head. Slight bitter aroma of nuts with sweet hints of figs, raisins and candy sugar. Bitter taste of nuts and dark bread with sweet figs and sugar during the finish. Pretty good!
Bottle given by a friend. Reddish brown, well-carbonated. Gives little away in terms of aroma. Taste is round, full, dry and somewhat bitter aftertaste. Good but not fantastic.
Crispbread, stable, hay rye, bready, bit sweet. Some bitterness in the finish

Bottle. Darker amber in color with a slightly tanned head. Ripe fruityness and damp but sweetish wooden notes in aroma. Fruity for sure in taste but theres a nice bitterness present as well. Bit of grainy vibes too. Good one.

Mahogany with ruby, light brown dense head, bit lacing. Ripe banana, plums, sweet and caramelly. Fizzy and bitter dry feel, long dry finish is woody, medium body. Nice aroma and looks. Dries to bitter woody finish which I dont enjoy that much.
Bottle. Caramel, wood and grass. Quite ok, but its more like a bitter than a pale ale.

It is a real persistent foam I first notice. The aroma is caramel malt with hints of nuts and invite really to no good beer. It has rich caramel flavor, again slightly nutty, but it is the malt that is the main theme of this lovely beer where both caramel and roasted malt almost beaten to satisfy my taste buds. Next, the slightly nondescript fruity transition to the hops. Now Im not a big hop expert in terms of hops, but its hop bitterness is gentle and never sharp in bitterness. This indicates that the hops are selected with care and that the brewery has managed to achieve exactly the hops balance in quantity and taste that fits just perfectly in this beer. I experienced also a softness and different feeling in the beer character. I can only venture a guess that this is because the local waters high quality i northern Sweden.

A copper beer, a blond head is quite small but dense. Aroma has herbal bread, some lemon and wood. Taste is bready, some toffee and nuts, quite strong bitterness, dry and herbal end. Medium bodied, nice and smooth to drink. Quite good, succefull bitterness.

(Bottle, 0.5 l - BB 16/11/15, at Pikkulintu, 20150731) The beer poured deep mahogany red and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, caramel and earth. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, caramel, earth, grass and bitterness. Aftertaste was malty and bitter. A tasty English style ale.

0.5 l bottle from local supermarket. Dark amber almost brouwn colour, English head. Not really pale. Taste has some sweet and wooden malts. Aftertaste has a fair amount of bittering hops. I think this a bitter rather than a pale ale. But nevermind the styles this is quite nice.

Bottle @ home. Pours a copper colored liquid with a small to medium tan head. Malty and fruity aroma with caramel, flowers, red fruits, biscuits, subtle apricots. Medium bodied and dry and quite smooth textured taste with a well balanced bitterness from start to after taste. Notes of flowers, herbs, biscuits, caramel, red fruits, apricots, nuts, toffee, some honey. Lasting grape like and earthy bitterness. Well balanced.

UPDATED: AUG 1, 2014 Flaska från SB. Kopparfärgad vätska. Fruktkakig doft med toner av bränd karamell. Blommig doft och så mer av fruktkakan. Ljuvlig balans med ett lätt torrt avslut. En bra pale ale.

Flaska från SB. 
Väldigt mörkröd vätska med ett vitt lågt skum. 
Doftar mycket sött, röda bär, karamellgodis. 
Mycket söt frisk smak, låg beska. 
Typisk engelsman, helt ok men rätt trist.
Bottle at Tröls. Malty with a lot of caramel, some butterscotch, citrus and grass.

Bottle 500ml @ home
Pours deep amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, floral and grass. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long caramel and grassy finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Aroma; caramel malts, kvass, wort, butter notes, bread. 
Brown red body, beige white head. Circles.
Taste; hops, caramel malts, citrus peel, butter, tiny red apple, butter caramel, hints of coffee.
To palate; nice, easy, distinct playing bitterness all under.
Finishes bitter n sweet, malts became slightly roasted, bread dough notes. Overall a pleasant surprise.
1/2L bottle 4.5% [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Luleå Sweden, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Norway.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2014 500ml brown bottle. Appearance is clear mahogany with a medium sized beige head that reduced quickly, leaving a little lacing. Aroma of lightly roasted malts, caramel, orange peels, apricots and maple syrup. Flavours of syrup loaf, lightly roasted malts, caramel and orange peels. Taste is light sweet and medium-heavy bitter. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Jämtlands Pilgrim is flavorful and with a notable bitterness, for a 4.5% ABV Ale it is outstanding.

bottle from Systembolaget. Pours clear deep ruby red with a dense off-white head. Aroma has caramel, biscuit, floral hops, light roasted notes. Taste is caramel medium sweetness up front with a light floral hop bitterness. Some roasted notes coming through and finish is medium bitter with a caramel touch. Smooth body, a minor bit watery finish.
Caramel and roasty aroma and taste. Beer is of dark brow color with lively carbonation. Good beer

Clear caramel colour, beige head. Aroma of caramel, malts, nuts and hops. Sweet malty flavour, nuts, caramel, quite bitter. Light bitter finish, caramel and nuts.
(From 50cL bottle @ home. From trade with lunnsen)

Den er brun i fargen, og lukter av fersk, fruktig humle. Skummet er hvitt og sitter lenge i glasset. Smaken er full av maltsødme, men også en god bitterhet som sitter lenge i munnen. På 4,7% er dette ølet meget fyldig og godt.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with airy off-white head. Clear aroma ofhops and flowers with subtle fruity and grassy notes. Bitter flavour of hops with notes of citrus and grass. Bitter aftertaste. Decent.

Pours dark reddish amber with low off-white head. Aroma of malts, bread, light citrus, cereal, grass. Taste is light bready bitter with soft bitter finish. Body is light yet creamy with soft to flat carbonation.

@ Röhällavägen. Flaska från Systembolaget (23:-). Fruktig, röda bär, bra beska, lång eftersmak.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
The first feeling is that it is a bit cowardly, but the taste grows and after a while it invites the malt in a nice palette of caramel, almonds and dried fruit, finished with a nice dose of hops.
500ml bottle rated from backlog. Brownis red with white head. Aroma sweet and malty, some caramel, fruit and roasted malt. Taste follows, malt, caramel, fruit and syrupy sweetness.
Caramel, raisin, and cinnamon bun aroma. Neatly balanced hops, sweet bread, and rubarb taste. Some cardboard in the aftertaste.
En söt, fruktig och frisk ale med en tydlig efterbeska som ligger kvar länge i gommen.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2016 När den svenska ölsmaken inte kan betraktas som annat än sekulariserad och de avgudar som dagligen tillbeds heter Björne brygg och Pripps blå är det glädjande att det fortfarande finns de som läser bryggarbibeln ordagrant. Förhoppningsvis går den här pilgrimsfärden så pass bra att vi hädanefter slipper trängas med lastpallar på Systembolaget.

500ml bottle. Brownred body with a white head. Sweet and creamy aroma. Elements of apricote, roasted malt, dried fruits, cherries, crispbread, bitter orange and dark, almost burnt, syrup. Light bitter after taste with a hint of bitter orange.

Overall a nice ale, although the body felt slightly thin.

Damn what a wonderful beer. The scent is quite lovely. The taste is good but maybe a little too thin. Had it any more powerful it had received the highest rating. The aftertaste is good and remains a good while. This brewery, I have only good things to say about. Buy their beer now.

Kaatuu lasiin punaruskeana ja kirkkaana, vaahto on tiivis ja pilvinen. Haju on karamellinen, savuinen, tuhkainen ja multainen. Tuhkaisuus on aika vallitsevana jättäen muut hajut taka-alalle. Maku on paahteisen tuhkainen, multainen, pähkinäinen puinen ja hieman lehtinen. Suutuntuma on tuhkaisen katkera, melkein jopa kitkerä. Kokonaisuutena tuhkaisuus peitti melkein kaiken muun alle jättäen vähän tunkkaisen kuvan tästä oluesta. Hedelmää tai karamellia olisi toivonut mukaan makuun, pähkinäisyyskään ei noussut kunnolla esiin.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear amber body, big lasting beige head. Aroma of caramel, chocolate and fruity hops. Taste is medium roasty, more fruity than the aroma, light smoke. A very nice and crisp bitterness. Finishes quite hoppy with a roasty touch.
Dunkel herber Beginn. Deutliche Bitterkeit, etwas trocken, geringe Fruchtnoten. Röstig-hopfig, wässrig grasig. 9/8/9/8/6/8
50 cl flaska fr SB. Kopparfärgad, bra skumkrona. Lite böd, en del malt och hygglig beska.
Mörkbrun öl, smutsvitt skum. Brödig arom, också med inslag av jordgubbssaft och röda äpplen. Fin beska i smaken, bröd även här, samt kaffe, röda bär och grapefrukt.

Den här ölen förtärdes under distraktion av märkliga människor och strålande sol, f.a.i.. Smaken var relativt kraftfull med en passande kropp och beskan var väldigt torr. Slutsats: ingen höjdare men situation vägde upp en del.

Pours dark amber with low head
High aromas of butter, honey and bready malts
Burned oaky flavour, buttery aley.
Ok!

Bottle from Systembolaget in Torp, Uddevalla. Pours a clear coppery body with a medium white head. Nose is deep malts, butterscotch, hints of caramel and burnt sugar. Moderate carbonation, slick mouthfeel. Highly balanced and rather nice.
50cl, as Jämtlands Pilgrim Ale, Swedish brew, from Systembolaget Göteborg, complex brew, malty/sweet and slightly fruity/bitter, balanced, clear, rocky head, good brew
0,5l bottle. Dark copper color. Very nice thick creamy head, stays. Caramel and hops in aroma. Roasted malts, hops, faint caramel in body. Long bitter ending.

Dark amber colour with an off white head. Hoppy and some caramel in the nose. Unusual high toffe sweetness for an pale ale but also a lot of hoppy flavour.[Bottle from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]
From old backlog. 500ml bottle from Systembolaget. Dark amber colour with medium head. Aroma and flavour is sweet, caramel with hoppy finish. Hope to retest some day.

50 cl bottle.
Rated on 20110605.
Pours clear copper color with large head. Aroma is quite faint with some bread and hops. Flavor of hoppy fruits, and bready malts. Dry palate. Not my favourite style but decent brew in its category.
4313

Pours a nice amber translucent red with nice carbonation running up the glass, and a nice one finger head. Aromas of bread, goldings, english-ish hops, strawberries, and maybe a little bit caramel.
Taste of nice crisp goldings hops, caramelmalts, maybe a little bit bread. Nice and balanced, quite bitter finish. Nice palate with good carbonation.
Bottled. Pours hazy brown and small brown head. Smells sweet bread malty. Tastes bread malty and very bitter with a clear bitter finish.
En av de mest prisvärda ölen på systemet! En öl som alltid ska finnas i kylen, året runt!

500mL bottle, courtesy of blomster. Thanks, Christer! Pours clear, somewhere between a dark tan and a light cola color; light-tan head with solid retention and persistent lacing. The aroma is malt-forward, showing toffee and cola and hints of darker caramel, with the hop character seeming on the periphery of the nose: minerals, earthiness, present but the opposite of assertive citrus. A perfect presence in the mouth: well-attenuated maltiness, rich caramel and toffee and a nuttiness without being cloying; the core bitterness shows through more than the aroma suggests: mineral and earthy, with a robust floral quality that wasnt overt in the nose. Medium-high CO2, medium to medium-light body, and just a nice balance between restrained malts and English-style hopping. Yum. Theres even a soft hint of smokiness or darker roast towards the finish; ends nicely bitter and on the dry side, with a hint of tea.

500 ml bottle bought @ Systembolaget. Pours dark amber with an off-white head that slowly dissipates while leaving lots of lacing on the glass. Smell is malty and slightly sweet with dark bread, soup stock, herbs and coffee. Taste is malty, floral and bitter with dark bread, caramel, coffee,  some metal, thyme and other herbs. Finish is rather dry, malty and bitter.

Bottle. Pours copper, with a off white. somewhat golden, head. The hops in the aroma has a classic herbal, pilsener-like charcter. Notes of coffee aswell. Taste is very well balanced. Toffee and coffe at the start, and some bitter herbal, and quite flowery, hops in the finish. Quite dry in the aftertaste, in the way of really dark bread or coffee. Highly drinkable and refreshing.

Bottle. Well appearance is more like a Brown Ale, but it pours a dark reddish/brown color with a beige head. The aroma is quite nutty with toasted malt, light general hop aroma, caramel, toffee and buttery notes. The flavor is also alot like a Brown Ale with toasted malt, caramel, toffee and buttery notes, marmalade, a general hop bitterness and some red berries. The body is medium with a dry mouthfeel. Overall a pretty tasty brew, but certainly not a PALE Ale, Id say a Brown Ale.

50 cl bottle @ home, BBE 08/2011. Rated on 05.06.2011
Aroma has toffee, caramel and some sweetish malt. Flavour has sweet and roasted malt with toffee and caramel. Tacky and dry EPA with lots of toffee.
Bottle, pours dark amber with off white head. Aroma is malty, caramel, fruits, toffee. Taste is sweet, and medium bitter.
Bottle. Creamy white excellent fully lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Light bitter woody dry flavor. Average light bitter finish. Oily palate.

Bottle 500ml. A clear dark amber colour with a large beige head. An aroma of malt, caramel and toffee. The taste is heavy sweet and medium bitter. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a long finish.
Bottle. Dark amber/brown with small tan head. Flavour is malt, caramel, fruit, hops and alight nutty.
Clear copper with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and light biter finish. 010911

En riktigt bra ale av engelskt snitt. Bärnstensfärgad, litet skum som sitter kvar på glasväggarna Blommig, jordig, lätt metallisk ton, liten sötma och syrlighet. Dock något tuffare beska och än den genomsnittlige britten. Lång eftersmak med lite kolatoner.

[500ml bottle, Akkurat, Stockholm] Deep reddish brown bitter with a thin, reducing head from the pour. Malty aromas, quite bready on the nose. Caramel and grassy hop there as well. Palate is reasonably rich, plenty of caramel comes through on the taste. Quite earthy and bitter, although that sweetness helps out, and takes over towards the end [30122008]
ambrato carico buona schiuma leggeremnte grossolana e quasi nocciola naso discretamente maltatato con note lievementi fruttate e luppolatte lieve terroso discreto amaro corpo medio
Bottle. From notes. Brown with a tan head. Nutty, fruity, malty, caramel and some smoke, medium bitter. Medium-bodied.

500 ml bottle.
Pours a reddish brown colour with a white, creamy, lacy head. Aroma of English hops and toasted nuts. Flavour of English hops, toasted nuts, toffee, hay and mild licorice. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel and a dry, bitter finish. Good.

I love Jämtlands, they all have I taste that I enjoy a lot. Thos beer is no expetion, full taste with fruit complexity, some yeast and that special Jämtlands bread like taste that i like so much, THis is smooth beer with a full taste and a long finish

Special Thanx to BOLAGSHATAREN for this beer!!!
The beer in the glass is a mixture of copper brown and ruby red. The foam is shallow and short lived. The beer smells with lots of aroma hops, also like resin and pinewood. It starts very hoppy, much more bitter than expected. It tastes like pinewood, paired with gorgeous aroma hops! The center part is a bit milder, but the great aroma hops are always dominant! The magnificent pinewood flavors hold up to the finish! Brillant Pale Ale from Sweden.
Dark brown body, tan small head. Aroma of fruits, nuts, sweet raisins. Flavour has the same. Very nicely balanced, strong bitterness.

Pours brown cherry red with small shortlived tanned head leaving a little bit lace, beautiful pour. Aroma is very pleasantly bready, malty, sweet, citric, beans and grass. Vry fruity mouthfeel. Fruity, very hoppy, malty and sweet flavor. Great fullbodied hoppy palate. Finishes fruity with a great longlived bitter bite.

Good beer. Nut, chocolate, coffee.  

21.80 SeK / 50 cl

Not sure why there is a character count. Can I not use RateBeer for my personal purposes?
50 cl bottle. Dark amber with a large offwhite head. Aroma; malt, nuts, vanilla and some smoke. Flavor; Malt with a smoke sence. ok
Tried on bottle. Pours a nice amber colour with a thick foam that disappears too fast though. Taste is rich with some bitterness.

Dark amber pour. Minimal white head with big bubbles. Aroma is grass, sunflower seeds, caramel, rye bread, and dark roasted coffee beans. Taste is a bit burnt, a bit acidic, malty, dark sirup, resin and some suttle coffee notes. Long bitter finish. Not bad.

08.08.2010, 0,5l Bottle. Dark brown colour with off-white head. Clear. Malty aroma with nice smooth hops. Very nice balance between maltyness, bitternes and sweetnes. Nice bitter aftertaste that lasts..

07-AUG-2010, bottle @home, from Systembolaget.
Surprisingly dark. I expected a lighter beer, but this is fine:-)
Brown ale like charachters. Charamelly malty with a bitter ending. Not a pale ale, but something much more malty than that. Fine brew. I could drink many of these. I would rebuy If I had the chance.

500ml bottle from Systembolaget, 16th Feb 2010. Thanks Tobias. Deep mid brown with a lively creamy head. Sweet and malty with a good caramel and toffee flavour. Similar aroma. Smooth palate. A nice brown ale.

50cl bottle from Systembolaget. Poured light brown with a nice looking white head. Aroma is roasted malt and fruity hops. Flavour is roasted malt, fruits and hops. Vanilla in finish. Ends bitter. Awesome Pale ale!

Appearance: Deep amber colour, medium beige head, lacing.
Aroma: Earthy hops, bready, caramel, roasted malts.
Flavour: Roasted, woody, fruity, finishing bite together with a bit of smoke.
Mouthfeel: Smooth real-ale-like.
Total: Good quality but nothing that stands out.

Bottle 50 cl. Bought somwhere in Sweden a while ago. Appearently this beer has won alot of medals in the beer-world in sweden. Clear dark redish brown with a smooth tanned head that fades.. The nose is surprisingly hoppy with a huge malty impression along with cane sugar. The taste is disappointing with a rather flat and watery palate. Its bitter hoppy wise and malty - thats about it. The finish is metallic and bitter. Better that expected with a nice aroma, but it doesn´t get me anywhere.

Caramellised sugar, malts, old wood, floral hoppy tones on the nose.Thick frothy/creamy head. Excellent lacing. Clear amber body.  Toasted malt sweetness and long heavy bitterness. Medium bodied, dry texture.
Bitterness became a bit too dominant, but still: more than drinkable.
Aroma is caramel, bread, resin, herbs and earthy. Taste is lots of earthy notes and a good bitterness that could last a bit longer imo.

Provdatum: 2006-09-01, bottle, Göteborg 

Guld, det bäst bryggeriet i Sverige
Bottle courtesy of omhper.  Pouts copper with a tan head.  Smells of earthy hops, tea, some grassy hints.  Tastes of caramel malt, peppery, grassy, some moderate spicy bitterness on the finish.

500 ml bottle. From Malmö, Sweden.
Dark reddish  brown colour with frothy average off-white head.
Roasted malt, nuts, hops and metal in aroma.
Dry hops, roasted malt, nuts and some sweet caramel in flavour. 
Dark and roasted flavour for a English Pale Ale.

Bottle from Systembolaget.

Pours mahogny with a big beige head.
Aroma of fuge and malt. Medium bodied with a taste of rosted malts with a hop bitterness finish.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2010 Dark brown with a reddish tint. Aroma is hop and yeast bread, really gets the attention of your nose. Nice fluffy off-white head that fades after a while to lace, and the lace is there to the end. Taste is slightly sweet, medium bitter, dry, hints of chocolate and coffee. Finnish is dry, hoppy and a bit of sweet. Lot of things going on with this brew, all good. Lots of body. A lot of character for sure. I really like this one and recommend to all.

Bottle. 

Dark clear amber, large and lasting tan head.

Nice aroma of caramel, fruity hops and roasted malt. Bread, malt, somehow roasted and a hoppy bitter finish. Quite good balance between the malts and hops.

Bottle. Malt, raisins. grass and hops in aroma. Clear deep redbrown colour with beige head. Bitter flavour where the malt disappears and it ends up very dry and bitter. Bitterness has got nothing to do with prilgrim travels, but dryness is wellknown after long walks in the sun.

Bottle. Pours clear deep reddish brown coloured with a big creamy off white head. Roasted aroma with notes of mild smoke/ash, grassy hops and cucumber. Flavours of bread, malt, mildly roasted and a hoppy bitter finish.
It poured a very dark amber liquid that was almost brown with a medium foam that left a nice lacing. It had a smell of grassy hops, caramell and some fruits. IT tasted of grassy hops and caramell.

500 ml bottle, from Systembolaget, thanks to Ole R! ABV is 4.5%. Dark brown colour, big and lasting tan head. Nice aroma of caramel malts and fruity hops, hints of roasted malts, resin and smoke. The flavour is well balanced between the malts and hops, some roasted notes, hints of burnt caramel, nuts, pine and resin, dry and bitter finish. Long bitter aftertaste.

500ml Bottle (Thanks Gnoff)  - Dark brown with red tinges and a foamy tan head. An enticing hoppy aroma with chocolate, roasted malt and hints of dried fruit. Hoppy, fruity and roasted taste with grapefruit, caramel, chocolate, roasted malt and more hints of dried. There is even a hint of coffee in there. Very tasty and has plenty of depth and flavour.

Botella. Dark brown colour, big well lasting beige head. sweet caramel and hoppy dark fruitish aroma. Good mouthfeel. sweet flavour of roasty caramel, bitter hops, dark fruits and citrus. Sweet hoppy roastish bitter finish. Quite good but just a bit too sweet.

Appearance: Very dark brown. OK amount of off-white head.
Aroma: Dark malt, some smoke. Burnt.
Taste: Quite bitter, dark malt. More bitter than expected.
Info: 500ml bottle, 19/6-2009
Stor smak med en beska som hamrar sig in, djupt och djupare. En mycket intensiv upplevelse som uppfyller alla krav man kan tänkas ha och lite därtill. Storartat!

Bottle. Clear dark amber body with a medium off white head. Hoppy aroma with caramel, flowers and a slight metallic touch. Medium to high carbonation. Flavour is bit roasty with caramel, nuts, hops, citrus and it ends up quite bitter and refreshing.

Bottled(500ml). -Clear cooper coloured, medium to big beige head that went away slowly, nutty herbal nose. Light roasted malt, coffee, caramel and fruity taste with notes of spices. Some short but quite odd touch of camomile hand cream.
A 0.5L bottle tasted at Pikkulintu. Some coffee and malt in the nose. Pale beige head. Dark reddish coppery colour. At the end hoppiness.Roasted malts. Slightly butter like taste.
Brown with large beige head. Sweet aroma with roasted malt, caramel and hoppy notes. Sweet flavour with roasted malt, caramel and bitter hops. Finished bitter.

Draught @ STBOWF. Stockholm Beer Festival 2008, Sweden.Clear medium to dark amber color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, fully lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, nutty, toffee. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [270908]

clear amber, nice offwhite head. quite strong aroma with slight winey sourish notes. caramel. flavor is caramel, brown sugar, slight roasted stuff. aftertaste goes roasted and slightly sweet. hops too nice.

50 cL bottle. Pours almost clear and deep hazzlenut brown with a small tan head. Dark caramel and slight roasted malty aroma. Light bitter flavoured with a nice chocolate and caramel malty note. Bitter and mild roasted malty finish. Smooth and dry, crisp. Light citric touch. Solid hoppy brew.

Flaske. Flot brun øl med en blomsterduft der forleder en i forhold til smagen. Smagen kommer som en overraskelse i forhold til udseendet. Fin bitterhed og i det hel taget en rigtig god forfriskende øl.

500ml bottle (Pikkulintu, Helsinki, Swedish Days 2008)
Rich reddy brown, healthy head. Raw mashy aroma, quite grainy. Taste is a touch buttery, but it’s a fulll malty body. Long hoppy finish. Nothing special, but a good hoppy beer where the hops don’t overload the tongue.
Redish brown with a medium tan head. malty and hoppy tones. Malt, hops and some caramel. Medium body with  long, bitter finish.

Pours a dark brown color with a nice tan creamy thick tan head. A fresh and slightly bitter and aroma with hints of coffe and licorice. Quite light flavor of roasted malt, coffe and bitter fruit. Well hopped with a strongly bitter finish.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are sweet caramel, fruits, malt and hops.

Bottle. Pours a dark amber colour with an off-white head. The aroma is very fruity and malty with notes of caramel and dried fruits. The flavour is dry and malty with notes of dried fruits, caramel and fudge. Nice bitterness in the finish.

Pours a deep red-orange with a 2 cm tan head.  Leaves a bit of lacing.

Smells of coffee, celery, licorice, lemon.  It’s fairly fruity in aroma, which I’m noticing to be fairly common for nearly all the Swedish beer I’ve tried.  They also seem to share a similar hops profile.

Mouthfeel is a bit creamy with medium carbonation.

Taste is hoppy bitterness, roasted malt, honey, grapefruit, toffee, and a tiny bit of strawberry jam.

Not bad at all.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2009 Bottle. Oh, this is a beer Ive had several times. Probably one of the first "craft beers" Ive had when my beer interest started to grow, and I must say, I still like it. It pours a brown color with a nice white foamy head. Aroma is malty and fruity, slightly nutty. I think its also a typical "Jämtland-note" in the aroma, but its not a negative thing. Flavour is fruity and malty with notes of caramel and nuts. A slight sourness makes it self visible, but its not to bad. Maybe a bit thin in the mouth, but on the other hand highly drinkable.

50 cl bottle - Copper brown with a small khaki head. Good blend of english hops with caramel malt. Flavor is full of nuts and caramel that turns to bitter chocolate towards the end. Enjoyable but not overly impressed considering the brewery.
Bottle. Red-brown color, beige head. Aroma of roasted malts and hops. Roasted flavor with fruity sidekick. A long hoppy and bitter finish. Bitter on the palate.

UPDATED: MAR 7, 2009 Bottle. Reddish brown color with a beige head. Aroma of sweet and roasted malt, fruit, smokiness, earthy hops, and butterscotch. Taste of roasted malt, earthy hops, fruit, tobacco, butter and toffee. Bitter and dry finish. 
Re-rated 090203.
Jackpot, I happen to like pale ale a lot. nicely hoppy and bitter, smooth and sweet, citrusy. medium bodied.

Bottle huge thanks to rickgordon! Aroma is a mix of pale malts and roasted black malts, grassy bittering hop. Taste is similar, not really balanced, but not not balanced. A simply confusing beer. But very very sweedish on very front.
Brown with a dense head. Hoppy aroma and a flavour of citrus, caramel and walnuts. Almost no carbonation and very soft. A nice one.

A Mes rate: 50cl bottle thanks to Jenny.Red amber with a decent beige head. Sickly sweet tobacco malt aroma. Flavour is over the top tobacco also. Smells for all the world like a tobacconist. Tastes like chewing a cigar. Would probably be ill if I drank too much of this. Not great.

(Bottle) Pale brown colour with huge, frothy beige head, leaving lots of lacing. Fruity, slightly roasted nose with notes of juniper bushes, toffee, caramel, bready malt and hops. Fruity, toasty taste with notes of juniper berries, toffee, a hint of sal ammoniac and spicy, earthy hops in a long, slightly bitter finish. Medium body, modest notes of sweetness. Very tasty, very balanced. Quite excellent actually.

50cl bottle from from Systembolaget.   Mostly clear copper brown with some yeast floating around and a small cream head.   This had a great aroma: starts of spicy, fruity, and hopy, but as the beer warms wonderful aromas of caramel and toasted malt come out.   Flavor is solidly malty with good hop balance, finish is dry and bitter.   Very well balanced, and the lighter body and smooth carbonation make it very drinkable.   Overall a fantastic bitter, and an excellent session beer.
Bottle at home ... copper colour ... fruity malt nose ... good malt base with a nice fresh hop overtones with a bit of roast malts and lots of smokeyness and dry hop  in linger.

Bottle. Bought @ Systembolaget, Strömstad. Pours a wonderful dark amber with an equally wonderful small creamy yellowish head. It stays alle the way to the end of the beer. Aroma has a clear caramel toffee with some fruity hoppyness at the back. Nice, full mouthfeel. Flavour has initial caramel sweetness before turning dry and relatively bitter. Very nice.
Draught. Very small, in fact hardly existing head. Clear dark red brown body. Fruity caramel aroma. Heavily carbonated and pretty bitter flavor. Long bitter aftertaste.

Pours a clear nutty brown with a beige head. Smells slightly toasted. Low sweetness with malty aromas of toasted grains. Mellow hoppiness. Toasted sweet finish. Medium carbonation. Light body. Nice touch with the toasted malts, maybe a bit too much, though... to make it balanced.
Soft hoppy aroma. Smooth, roasted flavour followed by the mild hops as from the aroma.

bottle 500 ml.
very little  clear white head, dies fast -
dark brown-  nice bitter aroma.
carbonation dissappears fast, dark burned and pleasant taste, some caramel in the finish.
a decent english bitter.
Brown colour with small head.500ml bottel,fruity with hoppy aroma strong and fresh taste with full body dry finish really good beer.

[Sampled with Thomas in Söderåsen, Skåne, Sweden.]
Clear copperred look with dissapearing head and almost no bubbles. Aroma of fruits and hops. Flavor of fruitmetal. Medium drinkability!

Bottle. Beautiful red brown body. Fully lasting head, a bit fluffy. Very fresh aroma, with pineapple. The flavour has a fruity start which develops into coffee. Very dry and bitter finish. Pleasant carbonation. Interesting development of flavour. (Ånn, 02.04.07)

Bottle. Dense, mostly lasting beige head over a clear, nut-brown body. Complex and gentle aromas of malt, fresh hops and fruits. Moderately sweet malty and caramellish taste with an appropriate hopbitterness. Also notes of roast and spices. Relatively lightbodied for the style. Smooth mouthfeel. Very inviting.

Bottle.Orangey brown colour with a fine beige head. Hoppy nose with caramel, even a hint of chocolate in good harmony. Chocolate caramel flavours matched by good bitterness, leaving a dry mouthfeel. Citrus hoppiness. A bit light-bodied. Quite nice.
Bottle. Clear amber colour with an off-white head.  Hoppy floral nose with some caramel and a tone of citrus fruits. Quite light flavour, hoppy and fruity.

Bottle... Clear copper ale with a large, foamy, off-white head and millions of floaties. Great retention.  Nose of subtle chocolate, black tea / English hops and light caramel. Perfectly-balanced flavor. Nutty caramel malt equaled by spicy, medium bitter, European hops. No residual sweetness. Light to medium-bodied with medium to lively carbonation. Iced tea, moderately bitter, dry finish.  Cheers to marsiblursi for shipping the bottle all the way from Sweden!

Bottle. Deep clear copper colour with a thick off-white head. Roasted malt aroma, with hints of dark fruit, along with grassy, earthy hops. Light bodied, but not watery. A massive but pleasant bitterness in the finish.

0.5 l bottle. Red color with creamy head. Parfumy, grassy and candy-like english hop aroma along with caramel malt. Dryer and somewhat salty flavor with biscuity and caramelly malt, berries and moderate bitterness. Salty, bitter and biscuity finish. A bit watery.

Offwhite head on an amber body. This beer has a very fresh taste, and is a real pleasure to drink. One of the best Swedish beers Ive had. Fruits, flowers and hops in the taste, in a very well-balanced combination. Worth the trip to Sweden.
Dark amber with a red hue and a nice head. The aroma is initially floral and hoppy, but then comes the malt along. The flavour has a nice bitterness, but also nice notes of roasted malt.

Decently understated bitter. Good foam and medium light brown colour. citrus and carmel. Drinkable and lower alcohol makes it quite the session ale, I liked that and good hoppiness and floral and cirus aroma. thanks Madsberg on our annual trade.good carbonation.
All in all, a very balanced and complex ale.. Its got it all, really nice malts and wicked hops. This is really nice.

Clear dark copper, with nice small creamy off-white head. Amazing fresh flowery hoppy aroma, with also a bit of citrus fruit and caramel. The body is very well balanced, with the slightly aggressive bitterness matched with a strong palate of crystal malt and some darker chocolate flavours. The finish is a little dry, with even more fresh hop flavours showing. Really enjoyable
Bottle 50cl - shared with Mette. Dark brown - offwhite head. Red berries, malty, flower + bitter hopped. I like this.
Bottle 0,5l. Brown colour. A large creamy tanned head. Fruity and malty aroma with some spice. Flavour of candy. Leaves you with a malty aftertaste with hints of chocolate.

500ml bottle hand-imported from Systembolaget in Kiruna. Clear, rusty brown in colour topped by a tight off-white head leaving nice lacing on the glass. Aromatic hops. Medium mouthful. Dark malty bitterness dominates the flavour with a solid touch of fresh fruit. Lovely bitter finish. Getting still better as it warms up in the glass.
A clear amber coloured beer. Has a real good flavor. Moderate sweetness and bitterness. Long malty finish, palate is slighty astringent.

500 ml bottle. Brilliant dark brown. Throws a tall off-white head that clings to the glass. Dark caramel, oaky and vanilla aromas. Rich, but slightly dry, roasted malty flavours with a clearly bitter base. Medium-bodied with not much sweetness other than the caramel malts that is hiding behind the roastedness. A well-done pale ale, a very quaffable one indeed.

UPDATED: FEB 16, 2007 (Draught at The Rover, Göteborg) Pours beautiful red/black with a white head. Soapy aroma with flowery and citrusy hops. Caramelly malt.  Flowery, grapefruity bitterness in flavour with a bit of cookies. Not so complex. Sharp, soapy and a bit sour palate. A taste of minerals.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2008 Cask, real ale, at Irish Pub in Sundsvall, Sweden. Red-brown color, beige head. Hoppy scent, very refreshing. Hoppy and bitter taste. More than average bitterness. Medium mouthfeel, but sort of a smooth feeling.8/4/8/4/17=4.1Rerate(Bottle from Systembolaget)Blind tasting on September 27, 2008Clear copper to brown color, tan to light brown head. Almond paste, perfumy, grainy, a bit fruity scent. Bitter apple, a bit thin taste. Lasting afterbitterness. A bit moussy mouthfeel, low bitterness.7/4/6/3/13=3.2
50 cl bottle. A roasty aroma with some citrus? Pours a dark brown with white foam, looks good :-) A nice, long finish.

50 cl bottle. No yeast at the bottom. Dark reddish brown colour with a nice creamy head. Nice sweet aroma with notes of caramel, little roastedness and a nice blend of hops. Great tasty flavour very smooth hoppy profil, also  notes of malt and little of toffee too. Very tasty just like originale English ales.

500 ml bottle, via MrWalker.  Pours a nice clear chestnut with a tight two finger off-white head.  Just a few rogue bubbles lazily float to the top.  Nice sweetly malty base with toffee and caramel under a light English hop aroma.  A little vanilla as well.  Hops are alot more aggressive in the flavor than the aroma implied.  Moderate bitterness blankets any sweet malt.  A slight metallic flavor comes thru late in the finish though.  Mouthfeel is creamy in texture, medium bodied, with pinpiont carbonation.  Overall, a pretty nice beer.  Flavorful, with a nice hop profile.

Dark brown colored, slight red hints. Medium beige head. Toffee, fruits, lemon, rye, dryness and mild caramel in aroma, aroma is fine and rich. Medium bodied. Flavor is thinner: starts with caramel and some lemon, aftertaste is bitter and dry.
UPDATED: JUN 7, 2008 Lots of white foam, dark red colour. Fruty and roasted aroma. A al thin body with a lots of fruity and nice bitternes, a nice combination, werry nice .

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2006 Aroma: elder, malt, sourishm slightly smoked, lemon peel, hops.

Appearance: dark orange brown, white (tiny beige) head.

Flavor: weak, mild, slightly bitter, soft sweetness, very fresh.

Palte: simple, fresh
Beautiful copper colour. Top fermented Englis style ale. Manages to be both sweet and dry - candy sugar developing into flowery, but crisp dry hops. Another winner from Jämtland!

Very fruity and sweet aroma, almost like those cloying sweedish ciders. Dark amber color, with lasting, white head. Full malty flavour, large carbonation and a very raw hopping in the finish. An easy drinkable, yet  robust ale.
Bottle. Clear dark amber colour with a long lasting tan head. Malty and hoppy aroma. Sweet malt flavor with a hoppy bitterness. Long bitter finish.

33cl bottle. Clear amber/red colour with white heat. Nice, light aroma of hay, flower, spruce and a little hint of toast. Moderate sweet flavour with a harmonic cascade hoppyness. American style ale. I love this beer.

Bottled. Cascade hoppy  masks the aroma.  Beige head. Red brown colour.
Moderate bitter finish.

Bottled. Clear amber beer with a beige head. Ok lacings. Aroma of orange and grapefruit and pinecones. Flavor has a hop-fruity bitterness. Full to medium body. Light sticky on the palate, and a long hop-bitter finish. Reminds me more of an american pale ale than an english one. (060113)

Dark red/amber color out of the bottle with a thin foamy cream colored head.  Light nose of fresh grains, buscuit malts and piney hops.  Lots of hops in this one with pine, grapefruit juice and orange peel but also has some bready malts, apple and some roasted malts.  Seems a little thin in places, but a very enjoyable everyday drink.  Thanks to MrWalker for the bottle.

Bottle
Chestnut, tanned low head.
Pine and nut aroma.
Herbal and aromatic, burned toasted notes.Medium body, burned aftertaste. Not entirely harmonious.

Bottle, at home.
Orange with off-white head. Aroma moderate malty and hoppy. Flavor moderate sweet and bitter. Light body, watery, soft carbonated. A fine hoppy taste.
Keg @ Stockholm Beer Festival 2005Rich in flowery hop aroma. Dark amber colour. Big body and nice bitterness balanced by a sweet maltiness and not overpowering.

Draught
Dark ruby, lots of lace, foamy off-white head. Flowery "greenfields" hoppy nose. Hoppy, honeyish and medium-bodied. Flowery yeasty. Good average bitter with extra "flowerness" in the hopping.
Draught. Dark amber colour with beige mediumsized longlasting head. Fruitish malty hoppy flavour. Hoppy finish, and hoppiness also in the long aftertaste.
Bottled. Red/amber colour. Small head. Doughy malt and citrus fruity hops aroma. Caramelly, malty, fruity and quite dry and hoppy in the finish. A decent ale. Thanks to MrWalker for this beer.
(Bottle 50 cl) Beautiful deep amber colour, almost no head. Fruity and dry with very marked hops. Nice. 020302

Bottle. Brown with a firm lasting head. Extremely malty nose with a lot of british hops also. The taste is also very malty with lots of toffee and with the hops adding flowery notes and a lovely fresh bitterness. This is clearly a beer within the British Ale tradition but it seems as a mixture of Scottish maltiness and English hoppiness. Very good.

Bottle. Best-before jan 2005, tasted july 2005. Medium off-white head, very dark red colour. Light roasted, hoppy nose. Subtle taste; some malts, some burntness, dry hoppy finish. A relatively light beer, taste-wise; unremarkable, but quite good.
Bottle. Very fruity aroma. Dry-hopped? Chestnut brown colour, small head. Nice bitter flavour with more of the same notes as in aroma. OK mouthfeel. Nice and tasty ale at a not very high ABV.
Bottle. Orange colour with a small off-white head. Malty light hoppy aroma and a sweet light roasted malty fruity taste. Medium body and a sweet light dry finish.
Amber/ copper colour with small off white head. Light roasted malty aroma with hints of a hoppy bitterness. Malty flavor with fruity notes and a dry bitter finish.

Bottled.
Clear orange colored wit a small off white head.
Nice hoppy aroma with malty notes.
Flavour is dominted by hops with malty and fruity notes.

Dark brown, thick white head.
Citric, hoppy nose. Fruity, bitter refreshing flavour. Excellent long bitter palate. Malty, full bodied.
Bottle. Excellent rocky head on top of a bright mahogany beer. Aroma is hoppy and flavor malty with good bitterness. Mouthfeel is a bit thin.

Dark amber. Almost red. Ofwhite head.
Has a nice toffee aroma and sweetnes.
I realy like this one! A exquisite bitter aftertaste.
Bottle. Amber-brown with small head. Malty, quite hoppy, minerals, medium-high bitterness. Medium-full body. Great session beer.

Dec 2004, Swedish dregs, Alts etc tasting w/MartinT, tiggmtl and Rastacouere #7.  500 ml bottle.  Dark maple-walnut with a decent bit of head...caramel strong in the nose, citrus overwhelming late...woody, dry body, almost ashen...little maltiness, somewhat thin.

Huge caramel malt, orange/grapefruit hops and some pastry-dough-like sweetness in the nose. Ruby-toned brown body topped by shy off-white/tan head that recedes to thin, large-bubbled cover. Flowery hops up front are subsumed with caramel and toffee malt flavours before returning in the very dry, slightly puckering bitter finish. Light body, low carbonation, a bit watery perhaps. Seems more like an Amber Ale. Bottle sampled with MartinT, muzzlehatch and Rastacouere. Thanks, Per!

A pond of grapefruit water on which sails a lone sweet cherry malt husk...Really dry hoppiness remains in force through the recovering anemics body...An unpretentious pint after a hard days hike...Thanks Per!!...

Clear dark brown pour. Gentle white head ring. Waffle-like sweetness fails to counter the huge grapefruity hops in the nose. Slightly earthy too. Very dry palate with a deep hoppiness, not quite chalky, but its in that league. Grapefruity, mineral. So dry you feel youre drinking this from a rock made glass. A bit watery texture, but you can feel from the beer that quality water was used. Light-medium body, light carbonation. Pretty good! Another pleasant consequence of Pers visit, thanks!

(Bottled) Clear, dark amber color with small head. Slightly sweet and sour-wineous, quite malty aroma. Sweetish, toffee flavor with lots of malt and aromatic hopping. Medium-bodied, quite dry and bitter palate. Must re-taste this one for a better rating...

Medium sized bubbles, light brown foam, and dark red-brown colour. Lots of foam and a massive crater!

The beer has got a strong, typical smell for an un-pasteurized brew: Lots of diacetyl and an almost chemical smell of malt.

The carbon oxide is fresh and surprisingly strong for an ale, but it works OK with the firm mix of malts.

The bitterness is almost perfect: Strong and robust. Yet, it doesnt get out of hand but it balances the complex blend of malts (Goldings and Caramel, I think) in a great way. There are some tones of fruit and a passing hint of parfume. The long aftertaste is first dominated of the sweet, buttery taste of the malts but after some time, the hops rises to the surface followed by a little sweetness. 

A very skilfully crafted ale, recommended to all lovers of this style. Frankly, I am impressed of the small Jämtlands Bryggeri, located in the north of Sweden: The Jämtlands Pilgrim can easily compete with the best British ales!

The name of this beer comes from the small village Pilgrimsstad (Pilgrims Town) where the brewery is located. The town was part of a medieval pilgrim route to the northern Norwegian town Trondheim, where the mortal remains of St. Olav (the most important saint in Scandinavia at the time) is buried.

Bottle, thanks to Per. Deep chestnut red, Good lasting off white head and delicate condition. Excellent blend of roast barley, piney hops and chocolate in the nose. Full bodied in the mouth with sweet chocolate dominated at first, then a roast barley note developing but the hop seems more muted. Finish has traces of chocolate around the edges but is mainly sweet and bitter.

Thanks to Per for sending this one my way!
Deep amber color with a huge creamy off white head. Caramel and malt in the nose. The flavor is sweet and needs more bitterness to be a good English Pale Ale but this is pleasant like a brown ale without the chocolate. Very nice beer.
Dark, with a nice head. Aroma from chocolate and toffee. Flavor is creamy with some bitterness.

Dark clear amber, ok head. Dark roasted malt aroma with hints of brown sugar. Dark roasted malt to the flavor as well with notes of nut and dark chocolate. Sweet with a bitter dry finish. Powerful flavor. Good!
Dark amber. Very nice brownish head. Aroma from tiffee, milk choclate and alittle spicy. But the flavor cannot match the aroma.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2004 Bottled: Amber coloured. Huge beige head. Aroma is malty and light hoppy with some sweet fruitnotes. Flavour is light roasty, malty, hoppy and has some chocolatenotes. Is pleasantly bitter in the end.

The aroma is very malty sweet - from a nice malt blend including caramel malt notes of nuts and yeast mixes in. Great aroma. The color is nut brown and it has a beutiful bubbly beige head. The flavor is sweet malty with notes of nuts and caramel which turns hoppy bitter in the middle just to end on a note of malty dryness coming from roasted and chocolate malt that lingers. A great and very complex flavor.
A decent pale ale with only mild bitterness, at most.  A tad sweet and overall a good choice from a very good brewer.
Beutifully balanced pale ale with strong chocolate notes in its perfect malty palate and dry hoppy aftertaste. Peak.
UPDATED: NOV 13, 2003 Ryby-brown with ok head. Taste of dark bread, toffee and some earthy notes. Long bitter ending, heavy malty notes of chocolate and toffee with some earthy hop.
Nutbrown, with an off-white head. Chocolate-aroma. Good bitterness and some fruityness.
Light red/copper color with an off-white head. Fruity berry-aroma. Mild hoppy start and a bitter finish.

This brewer must be a fan of the British Ale. So many of the best beers in Sweden the last ten years comes from this brewery.Check out the ChristmasAle (Julöl) if there are any left. But this is more like an English bitter with alower alcohol but a higher bitterness.

Dark red-amber color. Impressive aroma, a lot of malt and hop, reminding a barley wine. Dry taste, strong impact of hop, roasted malt and some malt and caramel. Final very strong, and of course really bitter (maybe a bit too much).More aggressive than <a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/ShowBeer.asp?BeerID= Postiljon.A very good ESB, enough aromatic, with a good roasted malt character.
Sweet malty cloudberrie aroma. Brilliant looking redish beer. A bitter aftertaste.

Glorious crystal clear amber brown  under a large tan head and nice ragged lace. Very berry fruity aromatic hops aroma. Medium to light bodied with mild smooth bitter  hoppy start. Some faint smokey roasted character. Falls a tad short on palate in the middle. The finish and aftertaste are also a bit light for my taste.
Highly enjoyable, very aromatic, lots of hops in the aroma. Very citusy, spicy, hopppiness, and perhaps a little oily or buttery, very good.
Very bitter and fruitish a classic EPA.
Very good and somewhat spicy aroma. Hoppy and fruity taste with a very bitter finish.
Flavour-full, fruity, somewhat roasted. Somewhat watery finish.
Lots of hops, lots of bitterness but not enough sweetness to balance it properly. It feels a bit coarse in your throat. Very little fruit.

Dark amber color.  Slight hoppy, dusty aroma - a little bit of tart fruitiness also in the nose.  Some maltiness and a long tart finish.  Dont know if it was supposed to be tart.  Old sample i believe.
A reddish brown well hopped pale ale. Reasonably malty, medium sweet, nice big, citrusy hop aroma followed by a balanced bitterness.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2003 Dark redbrown.
Malty with fresh hop aroma.
Malty flavor with cellar tones, caramel and tea.
Firm bitterness.
Excellent interplay between sweet, chocolatey malt and soft, herbal hops.
dark brown colour, strong malt aroma, hazelnut, butter flavor, bitter aftertaste, well-structured
